intro: Etlingera apus-hang, commonly known as the mountain lady’s tears, is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its erect stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in tropical gardens and botanical collections.
